content.description:
This climb is on the western side of Purgatory Rock. Scramble up to a ledge (class 3) at the base of two parallel cracks. Purified Fingers climbs the right finger crack. Delicate climbing at the start (crux) leads to easier fingers and feet.

Carefully choose your anchor location to avoid the rope feeding directly through the crack. This crack is a rope eater! It's best to have someone follow the route and then rappel off a webbing/chockstone anchor to the north.
content.protection: A single set of small cams and nuts.

content.description:
This climb is on the western side of Purgatory Rock. Scramble up to a ledge (class 3) at the base of two parallel cracks. Light of Salvation climbs the left hand crack. Good hands guide you to a ledge halfway up the climb. From the ledge, climb through a pocket of chossy rock (crux) to a perfect hand crack.

Carefully choose your anchor location to avoid the rope feeding directly through the crack. The crack loves to eat ropes on a lower or TR. It's best to have someone follow the route and then rappel off a webbing/chockstone anchor to the north.
content.protection: A single rack of BD C4 #0.5-3 with an optional double #2.
